name: redis-init
description: - You need to install a distros(distribution) for Linux lets take Ubuntu - First you need wsl (Also disable your antivirus, because sometimes it cries. This is 100% safe)   - Open cmd or powershell as admin     - `wsl --install`   - List out all distros     - `wsl --list --online`   - Install Ubuntu     - `wsl --install -d Ubuntu`   - Open Ubuntu from search bar     - For the first time it will ask you to set name and password     - Then install package universe `sudo add-apt-repository universe`, this will allow you to install all the open-source package like Redis which do not come under Ubuntu     - Finally install Redis `sudo apt-get intall redis` - Congratulations ðŸŽ‰ You have installed Redis, now to start Redis Server on you local machine type `redis-server` in your Ubuntu terminal. - Now open another Ubuntu terminal and type `redis-cli`, now you can communicate with your redis server - Remember not to close your Redis Server
